posts.author: SnorriHT
posts.content:
G'day everyone,

I am going to give WoG a go and I looked through the Greyhawk Pantheon to get inspiration. This story popped into my head...

He sat cross-legged on the blood-soaked grass, her head in his lap, watching the house, burn.
The acrid smell of fire, ash and death hung around him like a cloak.

As an apprentice blacksmith, he should have been long gone at dawn to prepare the village forge.
But something, at the back of his mind, encouraged him to linger a little longer at home with his new wife.

The dawn assault by the goblins was fast. He slew two with his Morningstar, in a cacophony of bone-crushing destruction.
The house was fired; he blindly staggered outside, shielding his terrified young bride from the heat.

A misshapen malcontent ran at him in the smoke. The Morningstar flayed the goblin, which fertilised the field with a fresh blood.
Something fast rattled past his ear. The sling bullet meant for him struck her in face...

...The Priest of Saint Cuthbert surveyed the aftermath. He was not here to provide succor for a mountain village after a Goblin attack.
He was here for him, an old soul in a new body, paying penance for the past. He briefly questioned his master's reasons, before instantly quashing the thought.

No, he was here for a divine purpose.
He was here for the Retributor.


I am hoping a simple warrior/rogue build with a twist would be a fun way to start in the World of Greyhawk.

The Retributor is  related to the Dark Prince No Dev Crit build http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 55432.html
The differences are:

- Retributors get to use Crippling Strike earlier;
- Dark Prince has Divine Might;
- Retributor has significantly better Will saves;
- Retributor has more Rogue levels, with an emphasis on the search / disable traps / open locks skills
- Dark Prince suggests a Greatsword, Retributor uses Morningstar and Tower Shield


The Morningstar provides dual piercing/bludgeoning damage (d8), using the higher damage type. I am hoping the investment into weapon focus and specialisation can be applied to two different physical damage types. The downside of the Morningstar is the 20 threat range and x2 crit multiplier. So instead, the idea is to deliver damage via poison, crippling strike and sneak attacks. The Retributor does not strike from shadows, so Blackguard summons, summons from UMD scrolls, or knocking a foe prone are the ways to deliver the pain.

The Retributor has the BAB to engage in direct combat and can self-buff with stacking Bull's Strength. The full suite of search / disable traps / open locks skills will allow the Retributor to negotiate traps and Spot will provide warning of hidden enemies.

The downside is no Dev Crit, no Epic damage reduction and the build only reaches fruition in the mid 20's.

Please let me know if the Retributor will be OK for WoG and is it suitable for epic levels? 

I would also welcome your suggestions on how to improve it :-)

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I would leave CON at 14 and add those 2 points to STR for better AB and damage, and maybe do the same with CHA.  I would also move Toughness to level 18 and take Improved Knockdown as early as possible (level 12, or if you can't take it there, level 15).  Finally, I would get Tumble all the way to 40 ranks for +1 AC.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hail SnorriHT
Rogue / Fighter / Blackguard is a seriously powerful combination
I know this because I have played one close to level 40 (level 38) on the WoG server.
This is the build thread for the Blackguard Executioner I wrote 6 + months ago
In it I go Rogue 13 / Fighter 8 / Blackguard 19
468hp with 45 base AB dev crit EWS and dev crit scimitar plus 311 skill points, 13d6 sneak attack improved knockdown and max taunt, this guy is designed to kill.
Either they get knocked down and die from sneak or they get knocked down and die from dev crit.
Valerfor told me back then it was deserving of being put in the 40s section whilst going through my 2nd or 3rd draft cycle of the concept, but there were still tweaks and things I wanted to put into it including skill point distribution also with wiser older eyes for example, I would swap resist energy and expertise for Great Fortitude / Iron Will and drop two great strengths for Epic Fortitude and Armor Skin, I value the fort saves much more than I did back then (I was ultra AB focused).
I might try to finalise this build sometime perhaps.

Anyway I link this essentially fully playtested build draft to you to give you some ideas, hope it helps with your own build concept.

Edit: Maybe one idea is to dump CHA down to 10 and pump up Str that is what I did at least when I wrote out multiple drafts and looked at the numbers
Dark Blessing is still quite useful even with CHA 10, drink an eagle's splendor for +1-2 to all saves, then drink the stat of choice for a further +1-2 to the save of choice 
Suggest avoiding going less than 10 with the CHA otherwise you will have -1 to saves without buffs
I remember I tried to put Divine Might in my original drafts but it just took up too much stats for little gain which I can see you have done the same
I think I settled on my Str 18 Con 14 Int 14 Cha 10 split to allow me to fully dump Dex and Wis but maybe a Str 16 Con 16 Int 14 Cha 12 might be ok

posts.author: SnorriHT
posts.content:
Thanks for the feedback Empyre and Orion :-)

I've dropped the CON and added STR. Tumble is now 40 and Improved knockdown is now earlier in the build.

I'm going think about CHA though, as the higher universal saves from Dark Blessing is the "participation award" for no Dev crit...

I've also had epiphany that Divine Might may be a worthwhile option, as it ignores damage resistance and damage immunity. That adds to the Morningstar's mystique of differing damage types in the same weapon.

Orion, thanks for the playtested executioner build, that is a beast! You should seriously consider putting it into the 40's section.
